thread.title: Tolbert tosses 3 TDs,defense gets 3rd shutout as Lanier blanks Heritage
thread.title_full: Tolbert tosses 3 TDs,defense gets 3rd shutout as Lanier blanks Heritage

author: AccessWDUN staff
title: Tolbert tosses 3 TDs,defense gets 3rd shutout as Lanier blanks Heritage
text:
By AccessWDUN staff Related Articles 2015 High school football rankings 2015 High School Football region standings WEEK 8: Surprises abound in wild night of prep football VIDEO: Rabun County routs Union County in top 10 showdown, 49-3 
SUGAR HILL — The Lanier defense pitched its third shutout of the season Friday night as the Longhorns took a 42-0 win over Heritage, Conyers at Lanier Community Stadium. 
The Longhorns (7-0, 6-0 Region 8- ) held the Patriots (0-7, 0-6) to just 75 total yards, only 14 rushing, and just five first downs for the game. 
Meanwhile, Lanier, behind a combined 155 yards from brothers Marcella and Marcko Baity, racked up 210 yards on the ground. The Longhorns also got a solid game from senior quarterback Tahj Tolbert, who was 13-of-19 passing for 90 yards with a pair of touchdown passes. 
Despite the dominant win, the game was tied 0-0 going into the second quarter. But the Longhorns exploded for 21 points over a seven-minute span in the second quarter. 
Tolbert connected with Tyler Taylor on a 5-yard touchdown pass with 8:58 left in the half and then tossed an 18-yard scoring pass to Marcko Baity four minutes later for a 14-0 lead. Marcko Baity then added an 18-yard touchdown run with 2:02 left in the half for a 21-0 lead. 
Marcella Baity added touchdown runs of 11- and 8-yards in the third quarter and Noah Fritz capped the scoring with an 11-yard touchdown run in the fourth quarter. 
The Longhorns will face a pair of tough road games over the next two weeks traveling to Salem and then Winder-Barrow as they try to wrap up their second straight region title.
